  • Method Details

    • getBothMovementMove

      public Envelope getBothMovementMove​(java.util.ArrayList<Square> moves1, Builder builder1, java.util.ArrayList<Square> moves2, Builder builder2, Player player) throws java.io.IOException
      sends to a specific client all the available moves with both builders and waits for the player response on whitch to use. if an arrayList is empty signifies that the corresponding builder cannot move from it's position.
      Parameters:
      moves1 - ArrayList containing all the available moves for the first builder.
      builder1 - the first player builder.
      moves2 - ArrayList containing all the available moves for the second builder.
      builder2 - the second player builder.
      player - the player that has to choose the move.
      Returns:
      the move that the player has choosen.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getMovementMove

      public Envelope getMovementMove​(java.util.ArrayList<Square> moves, Builder builder, Player player) throws java.io.IOException
      used to ask for a second move after the first one (on the special phases). sends the player the new available moves and waits for the response. if the player chooses not to use a special moves a null answer is expected.
      Parameters:
      moves - is the new possible moves.
      builder - is the builder that is able to move again
      player - is the player that has to choose.
      Returns:
      the move chosen by the player or null if the player choses not to take a special action.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getBothBuildMove

      public Envelope getBothBuildMove​(java.util.ArrayList<Square> moves1, Builder builder1, java.util.ArrayList<Square> moves2, Builder female, java.lang.Boolean canBuildADome, Player player) throws java.io.IOException
      method used to ask the player with whitch builder he wants to build if it is allowed by the card of the player.
      Parameters:
      moves1 - the places where the first builder can build.
      builder1 - the first builder.
      moves2 - the places where the second builder can build.
      female - the second builder.
      canBuildADome - true if the second builder can build a dome.
      player - the player that has to choose where to build.
      Returns:
      an Envelope Object with the choice of the player.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getBuildMove

      public Envelope getBuildMove​(java.util.ArrayList<Square> moves, Builder builder, java.lang.Boolean isDome, Player player) throws java.io.IOException
      asks the player where does he want to build this turn
      Parameters:
      moves - is an ArrayList of Squares containig all the places where the player can build.
      builder - is the builder that is going to build.
      isDome - is a Boolean that if is true signalizes that the player can also build a dome.
      player - is the player that has to choose where to build
      Returns:
      and Envelope Object containing where the player wants to build and if he wants to build a dome. if the player has the opportunity to choose to build or not the method can return null if the choice is to not build anything.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getCards

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getCards​(Client dealer, java.util.ArrayList<Card> deck) throws java.io.IOException
      method use to make the Dealer choose whitch cards will partecipate to the game.
      Parameters:
      dealer - is the dealer player.
      deck - is the Deck containing all the cards.
      Returns:
      an arrayList of integers containing the index number of the choosen cards.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getChosenCard

      public java.lang.Integer getChosenCard​(java.util.ArrayList<Card> possibleCards, java.lang.Integer clientID) throws java.io.IOException
      method used to make a player whitch card he wants to use for the game
      Parameters:
      possibleCards - the available cards to choose
      clientID - the ID of the client whitch has to choose the card
      Returns:
      the number of the card choosen by the player
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getBuilderPlacement

      public Square getBuilderPlacement​(java.util.ArrayList<Square> possibleSquares, int clientID, int buildernumber) throws java.io.IOException
      method used to ask one player where he wants to place one of its builders at the beginning of the match.
      Parameters:
      possibleSquares - all the available squares to place the builder.
      clientID - the ID of the client whitch has to place the builder.
      buildernumber - a number used to distinct from first and second builder.
      Returns:
      the Square where the player wants to place the builder.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • squareToString

      public java.lang.String squareToString​(Square square)
      converts a Square object to a String containing the coordinates
      Parameters:
      square - is the square that is going to be converted
      Returns:
      a string with the x and y coordinates of the square separated by ","

    • arrayListSquareToString

      public java.lang.String arrayListSquareToString​(java.util.ArrayList<Square> moves)
      converts an arrayList of Squares to a string, is used to help serialize the information to send to the client
      Parameters:
      moves - is the arrayList of Squares
      Returns:
      a string with the coordinates of all the squares of the arrayList the x and y of the same Square are separated by "," two different squares are separated by ":" the string ends with @

    • builderToString

      public java.lang.String builderToString​(Builder builder)
      converts a builder object to a string containing the coordinates of the position on the board.
      Parameters:
      builder - is the builder that is needed to have converted.
      Returns:
      a string containing the builder.

    • wantsToBuildADome

      public java.lang.String wantsToBuildADome​(java.lang.Boolean isDome)
      is used to set the message to signal that the player can also build a dome.
      Parameters:
      isDome - if is true the player has the possibility to build a dome.
      Returns:
      String:"1" if isDome is tru, String:"0" if the boolean is false.

    • stringToBuilder

      public Builder stringToBuilder​(java.lang.String string)
      converts back a string with the coordinates of the position of a builder to a builder object usable by the controller.
      Parameters:
      string - the string with the coordinates x and y separated by ",".
      Returns:
      a builder object.

    • stringToBool

      public java.lang.Boolean stringToBool​(java.lang.String string)
      reads an integer from a string a converts it to a boolean. '0' is false '1' is true.
      Parameters:
      string - is the string from where to read
      Returns:
      true if the number in the string is '1', false if it is '0'.

      Parameters:
      player - the player.
      Returns:
      the client object relative to the player.

    • cardToString

      public java.lang.String cardToString​(Card card)
      converts a Card object to a string
      Parameters:
      card - is the card that needs to be serialized
      Returns:
      a string with the name of the card "," the description of the card and ": " as separators

    • stringToSquare

      public Square stringToSquare​(java.lang.String string)
      converts a string containing coordinates x and y separated by "," to a Square with x and y coordinates.
      Parameters:
      string - is the string that contains the coordinates
      Returns:
      a Square with x and y coordinates and all the other values set to 0.
